trial_identification.studytitle: Using oral broad-spectrum antibiotics as an adjuvant therapy in conservative management of lumbar disc hernia; a clinical trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of ciprofloxacin/co-amoxiclav administration during conservative management of patients with herniated lumbar disc on pain severity and patient's satisfaction

interventions.interventions: at least 90 patients with lumbar disc hernia who are candidates of conservative (nonsurgical) treatment will be randomized in three 30-patient, age- and sex-matched groups. Management will be similar in all three groups. One group will receive oral ciprofloxacin, 500mg twice daily for 2 weeks. Another group will receive oral co-amoxical 250 mg three time daily for 2 weeks. In the third group no antibiotic will be administered.
interventions.comparator: Only standard management including advice to rest and stay inactive for at least 2 weeks, as well as conservative (nonsurgical) treatments such as analgesics and anti-inflammatories. This is the group that will not be administered any antibiotics.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Pain score according to visual analogue scale (VAS)

secondaryOutcome.outcome: SF-36 score (functional health and well-being sections)
Patient's satisfaction rate using a likert scale system: 5=Very satisfied, 4=Satisfied, 3=Neutral, 2=Dissatisfied, 1-Very dissatisfied.
The level of serum C-reactive protein(CRP) using the enzyme-linked immunosorbent assay (ELISA) and erythrocyte sedimentation rate (ESR) using the Westergren method

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Patients with lumbar disc hernia who are candidates for conservative (nonsurgical) treatment with symptoms present for >6 months
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Candidates of surgical treatment, those with active infection, and patients with previous spinal surgery

trial_design.concealment: Numbered containers will be used for consecutive attending patients at department of neurosurgery.
trial_design.sequence: Simple randomisation using a randomisation table created by computer software
trial_design.statisticalmethods: The Chi-sqaure or Fisher's Exact test for categorical data; One-way ANOVA with Tukey post hoc analysis or the Kruskal-Wallis test with an appropriate post hoc analysis for numerical data based on their distribution. To detect a pain relief=1.5 units according to VAS, with a standard deviation=2 (according to previous reports), at a significant level of 5% (a two-sided t-test) with 80% power 27 patients were needed in each group, which was augmented to 30.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: According to results of some recent studies, infection may cause Modic changes. This study aims to investigate whether antibiotic therapy along with conventional management of non-surgical lumbar disc herniation may cause better and/or rapid amelioration of symptoms.
